Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a healthy plant that has enough water and sunlight.
The student can draw a plant that is not healthy because it lacks water.
The student can show that plants need water to live and grow through their drawings.
The student can illustrate the difference between a watered plant and a plant without water in their drawing.
The student can demonstrate that patterns in the drawings show evidence of how plants change with and without water.
